description: From Ancient Greek ἀμίαντος (amíantos, “undefiled”), from ἀ- (a-, “not”) + μιαίνω (miaínō, “I defile”).

entries.meaning: A type of asbestos with long, soft, thin fibers.
examples: the Microscope can afford us hundreds of Instances of Points many thousand times sharper: such as  […]  the ends of the stiriæ or small parallelipipeds of Amianthus  […]
